bio.line: My name is Aleksi Väisänen and I'm currently a Computer Science and Engineering student at the University of Turku. I began my studies in fall 2017, right after my conscription. Before that I studied in Kerttuli upper secondary school. I was in the ICT oriented line of study, where I was able to learn programming besides my normal studies and also do some university courses in programming.

I am a sporty person and I especially enjoy long runs and playing disc golf. I'm currently training for the Paavo Nurmi half marathon 2018 and hopefully I'll also be able to participate in other running events the next summer.

education.description: My studies consists of natural sciences, computer science and engineering. The bachelor's degree consists of 180 academic credits and the master's degree consists of 120 academic credits.

education.degree: 13 academic credits worth of programming courses
education.description: I took three programming courses in the Open University of Turku while studying in Kerttulin lukio. I was able to include these studies to my current studies in the University of Turku.
In Kerttulin lukio, I was able to replace many otherwise compulsory courses with IT courses. I studied a lot of programming besides my normal courses thanks to the ICT oriented line of study.

work.description: I have a strong background in the family business. I've been a part of KirEe Oy more or less since 2012. Some of the biggest projects I've been a part of are Mein Schiff 5 and Mein Schiff 6 Himmel und Meer suite installations. In 2016 I made a new homepage for KirEe Oy and in 2017 I was a part of the workgroup that put the performance reward system to use. I created the quality manual as well as Excel-based working hours monitoring system in 2017. Mostly I'm responsible for the firm's IT-side of things, but if needed I can also be a part of the production line.

projects.title: Website for KirEe Oy
projects.description: Full design and implementation of the KirEe Oy website
